content:
Hello and welcome to Mini: 1553. This game has no flavor, but may include some awesome pictures to liven things up.

Spoiler: rules
Rules
1) Site wide rules apply they can be found here.
2) This is a game. Try to not take it too seriously.
3) This game is to not be spoken about or discussed in any way shape or form outside of the thread. This includes public and private messages.
5) All votes need to be bolded or inside of the VOTE: tags. Try to keep these on separate lines.
6) A lynch requires 50% of the alive players votes +1.
7) A no lynch may occur if 50% of the alive players vote no lynch.
8) If a lynch is not achieved by deadline, a no lynch will occur.
9) Days will last 3 weeks and nights will last 3 days.
10) Once you are dead, you are dead. There will be no more posting after you flip.
11) Once someone is lynched, everyone, including the lynchee may talk during twilight until the mod locks the thread.
12) Prods will be handed out every 48 hours. Three prods and I reserve the right to replace you.
13) Keep all text readable and visible to everyone.
14) Pretending to break a rule, is the same as breaking the rule.
15) I reserve the right to change rules at any time.
16) If I have made an error, contact me via PM.
17) This is my color. It is mine and only mine to use. Use your own.

I think when I'm scum, I tend to obsess over how I'm perceived from a meta-perspective - that is, I worry that if I ignore scum buddies I'll give myself away through them, or if I nightkill someone suspicious of me it would give me away. In real life, I tend to giggle more, but that's unhelpful here.

Now, your turn.

This question in particular interests me in people (even outside the game), for various reasons.

I've seen games where there was never a random vote placed, and they fascinate me. I think it's important to try to push scum into saying scummy or otherwise telling things, and it's absurd of me to expect that I can sit back and just wait for scum to reveal themselves.
